intro: Diallobus tora, commonly known as wild cotton or tora, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and hairy, capsule-like fruits. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
